nitf
Class SegmentReader

java.lang.Object
  nitf.NITFObject
      nitf.DestructibleObject
          nitf.SegmentReader

public final class SegmentReader
extends DestructibleObject

SegmentReader

This class provides a "jailed" IOHandle to the data in a segment.

See Also:
Reader.getNewGraphicReader(int), Reader.getNewTextReader(int)

destructMemory

protected void destructMemory()
Description copied from class: DestructibleObject
Actually destructs the underlying memory.

Specified by:
destructMemory in class DestructibleObject

read

public boolean read(byte[] buffer,
                    int count)
             throws NITFException
The read function reads data from the associated segment. The reading of the data is serial as if a flat file were being read by an input stream. Except for the first argument, this function has the same calling sequence and behavior as IOHandle.read.

Parameters:
buffer - buffer to hold data
count - amount of data to return
Returns:
true on success
Throws:
NITFException
See Also:
IOHandle.read(byte[], int)

read

public boolean read(byte[] buffer)
             throws NITFException
The read function reads data from the associated segment. The reading of the data is serial as if a flat file were being read by an input stream. Except for the first argument, this function has the same calling sequence and behavior as IOHandle.read.

Parameters:
buffer - buffer to hold data
Returns:
true on success
Throws:
NITFException
See Also:
IOHandle.read(byte[], int)

seek

public long seek(long offset,
                 int whence)
          throws NITFException
The seek function allows the user to seek within the extension data. This function has the same calling sequence and behaivior as IOHandle.seek. The offset is relative to the top of the segment data.

Parameters:
offset - the offset in the file
whence - the type of seek, either SEEK_CUR, SEEK_SET, or SEEK_END
Returns:
the position in the file after the seek
Throws:
NITFException
See Also:
IOHandle.seek(long, int)

tell

public long tell()
          throws NITFException
The tell function allows the user to determine the current offset within the extension data. This function has the same calling sequence and behaivior as IOHandle.tell. The offset is relative to the top of the segment data.

Returns:
the current file pointer position
Throws:
NITFException
See Also:
IOHandle.tell()

getSize

public long getSize()
             throws NITFException
The seek function allows the user to determine the size of the data. This function has the same calling sequence and behavior as IOHandle.getSize.

Returns:
the size of the file descriptor
Throws:
NITFException
See Also:
IOHandle.getSize()
